Everything looked familiar â€” the air, the people, the languages â€” but something wasâ€¦ off. He walked through the streets of a place that seemed like Delhi. But there it was â€” the Gateway of India standing tall where India Gate should be. Confused, Sachin kept exploring. He realized he had landed in a parallel world, where famous landmarks existed, but they were in the wrong cities. Each city had been swapped with the identity of another, and now it was up to Sachin â€” and you â€” to make sense of this twisted map. Example: If the response is "Chennai", look it up in the table to �nd it has the Charminar landmark. Then based on the instructions, call the appropriate endpoint. âœˆ Step 3: Choose Your Flight Path Once you know the landmark associated with your favorite city, follow these instructions: �. If landmark belonging to favourite city is "Gateway of India", call: GET https://register.hackrx.in/teams/public/flights/getFirstCityFlightNumber �. If landmark belonging to favourite city is "Taj Mahal", call: GET https://register.hackrx.in/teams/public/flights/getSecondCityFlightNumber �. If landmark belonging to favourite city is "Eiffel Tower", call: GET https://register.hackrx.in/teams/public/flights/getThirdCityFlightNumber �. If landmark belonging to favourite city is "Big Ben", call: GET https://register.hackrx.in/teams/public/flights/getFourthCityFlightNumber �. ğŸ§  Mission Brief â€” Sachin's Parallel World
Discovery
"The �ights are live, but the codes are scrambled. It's time to explore, understand, and �y."
â€” HackRx Core Team
ğŸŒ The Strange New World
Sachin, one of the core members of HackRx, woke up in a strange version of Earth. Everything looked familiar
â€” the air, the people, the languages â€” but something wasâ€¦ off.
He walked through the streets of a place that seemed like Delhi. But there it was â€” the Gateway of India
standing tall where India Gate should be. Confused, Sachin kept exploring.
He realized he had landed in a parallel world, where famous landmarks existed, but they were in the wrong
cities.
Each city had been swapped with the identity of another, and now it was up to Sachin â€” and you â€” to make
sense of this twisted map.
Your goal: Find the �ight number which takes him the real world
